question_text: What are error codes on screen during POST and how should you interpret them?
answer_options: Software error messages that can be ignored during startup
Numerical or text messages indicating specific hardware problems - consult manufacturer documentation
Normal boot messages showing successful component detection
Network connectivity errors that resolve automatically
correct_answer: Numerical or text messages indicating specific hardware problems - consult manufacturer documentation
explanation: Error codes on screen are numerical or text messages displayed during POST that indicate specific hardware problems. They should be interpreted by: 1) Recording the exact code, 2) Consulting the motherboard/system manufacturer documentation, 3) Cross-referencing with beep codes if present, 4) Identifying the failing component based on the code meaning.
